div.head: To al that affect the famous exercise of ARCHERIE frequenting Finsburie fieldes.
div.p:
SHooting in the long bow being of it selfe very laudable, and our English nation in all ages surpassing therein all others, yea neither the Getes, Seythes, Parthians, Sarmathians, Armiaspes famous for that quality, nor any other people could become equall with English Archers. And yet (a matter to be lamented) this laudable exercise of late dayes hath become cold in most places of this land, famous Londō retaining the most ardēt desire to maintaine the same, as appeareth by the daily concourse of Citizens, to their great commendations, in diuerse companies in the conuenient fields about the citie, but most especially in that choise place Finsburie,
most especially garnished with many beautifull Markes in this little Treatise Alphabetically mentioned, whereby the benefactors therein shall haue perpetuall memorie recorded by the titles of their seuerall erections.

And for that euery hand ought to bring some portion of helpe towards the preseruation and increase of so commendable actiuitie, we haue (by the helpe of our friends) cast in also our mite, wishing it to worke a continuing in the old, and a growing goodwill in such yong beginners as would become skilfull in this most acceptable qualitie, for whose sakes this litle worke is reuiewed, reuiued and republished, with such necessary, easie, and helpfull obseruations as may seeme best to satisfie those that are desirous to come to knowledge in the Markes.
